diff_hunk:
@@ -64,6 +64,15 @@ $PYCMD test_cuda.py $@
 echo "Running NCCL tests"
 $PYCMD test_nccl.py $@
 
+echo "Running C++ Extensions tests"
+cd cpp_extensions
+$PYCMD setup.py install --record installed_files.txt
body: The problem with virtualenv is that you'll lose access to the PyTorch you already installed. Maybe there is a way to make stacked Python environments; that would definitely the preferred resolution.
